title: Trump signs global 10% tariff order hours after Supreme Court strikes down 'reciprocal tariffs'
subhead: After the US Supreme Court ruled that President Donald Trump had exceeded his authority by imposing tariffs on virtually all US trading partners, Trump earlier said he would circumvent the decision and use another law to impose uniform tariffs, which he then said he signed off on later on Friday, 'effective almost immediately.'

title: French activist's death ignites Italy's far-right circles
Newsom and Pritzker demand refunds after US court tosses Trump tariffs
UNRWA's cash flow problems force it to scale back its services in the Middle East
subhead: The United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees' schools and health centers have had to reduce their services by 20% due to insufficient funding. Its donors have come under pressure from the US and Israel, both of which have accused UNRWA of collusion with Hamas.

title: CEO of Mistral AI says warnings about extreme risks of artificial intelligence are often 'distraction tactics'
subhead: Arthur Mensch stands out for his views on the risks posed by artificial intelligence, which have been voiced by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei.

title: US freeskier Ferreira wins halfpipe gold: 'I'm finally in the history books'
subhead: 31-year-old Alex Ferreira won halfpipe silver at the 2018 Pyeongchang Games and followed up with bronze in Beijing four years later.

title: In legendary Swiss village of Sils-Maria, the Chesa Marchetta hotel blends art with the art of living
subhead: Gallerists Iwan and Manuela Wirth chose the Swiss canton of Grisons to open their second location. They entrusted the restoration of this former mountain inn to architect Luis Laplace, who took care to remain faithful to the rustic spirit of the place while punctuating it with works of art.

In Dhaka, Sheikh Hasani's palace has been turned into a museum honoring victims of the July 2024 uprising
Real or faux, vintage or new, fur is no longer hiding
Gaza's local authorities massively underreported deaths, says international research team
subhead: The first independent field study on Gaza to not involve local authorities, published in The Lancet Global Health on Wednesday, concludes that the number of violent deaths linked to the conflict has been underreported by about 35%.

title: France's image deteriorates in the eyes of American investors
subhead: According to the annual barometer of the American Chamber of Commerce in France, 77% of American companies operating in France said they did not trust 'the government's ability to carry out the structural reforms deemed necessary.'

title: Xavier Dolan, filmmaker: "Where does the idea that artists should 'stay out of politics' come from?"
subhead: A controversy is stirring at this year's Berlinale. At their opening press conference, the jury members declined to comment on the situation in Palestine, with their president, Wim Wenders, arguing that cinema should 'stay out of politics.' Canadian director Xavier Dolan responds to him in an op-ed for Le Monde.

title: France-Germany: Urgent action needed to resolve the crisis
'Today, 96% of the world's nuclear weapons are held by states with authoritarian leaders'
Rejecting political violence
